tournament.name: The Arena Open Day 1 Â– 7 Win

decks.notes: The deck focuses on quickly assembling a board presence by playing creatures with powerful effects like Beanstalk Giant, Bonecrusher Giant, and Lovestruck Beast. The key synergy comes from cards like Edgewall Innkeeper and Lucky Clover, which allow you to draw cards and double up on the effects of adventure cards. Fae of Wishes gives you access to a sideboard toolbox, while Escape to the Wilds lets you ramp and play additional cards in a single turn. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm your opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and resource advantage.

This deck focuses on using the Adventure mechanic to quickly put pressure on the opponent. By playing creatures with powerful Adventure abilities like Bonecrusher Giant and Brazen Borrower, the deck aims to control the board and deal damage efficiently. The inclusion of cards like Lucky Clover and Edgewall Innkeeper helps to generate card advantage and maintain momentum. Additionally, Escape to the Wilds allows the player to access more resources and potentially close out the game. The mana base is designed to support the deck's varied color requirements and ensure consistency in casting spells.

The deck focuses on building a strong board presence quickly by playing efficient creatures and utilizing adventure cards. The key strategy revolves around generating value through cards like Edgewall Innkeeper and Lucky Clover, while also providing disruption with cards like Brazen Borrower and Bonecrusher Giant. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a mix of aggression and card advantage, utilizing the adventure mechanic to keep up tempo and pressure on the opponent. The mana base allows for consistent casting of spells while also enabling powerful late-game plays with cards like Escape to the Wilds.

The main concept of this Azorius Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of flying creatures. The deck focuses on utilizing cards like Winged Words and Rally of Wings to draw cards and give your creatures a power boost, respectively. The deck features a variety of low-cost creatures, such as Healer's Hawk and Loyal Pegasus, as well as some more powerful creatures like Skycat Sovereign and Sephara, Sky's Blade. Hushbringer is included to disrupt the opponent's strategies, while Hanged Executioner and Cloudkin Seer provide additional support.

The deck revolves around quickly cycling through cards to consistently deal damage and finish off opponents. By utilizing cards that have cycling abilities, along with cards that benefit from cycling, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast and efficient attacks. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion adds an extra layer of versatility and value to the strategy. Overall, the goal is to effectively use cycling and aggro tactics to outpace and outmaneuver opponents in order to secure victory.

The deck focuses on using cycling cards to quickly amass resources and deal damage to the opponent. By cycling through cards like Flourishing Fox and Drannith Stinger, players can build up their battlefield and hand advantage before finishing off their opponent with a powerful Zenith Flare. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for additional value and recursion from the graveyard. The deck aims to be fast and aggressive, overwhelming opponents with a combination of powerful cycling payoff cards and combat tricks.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy through hand disruption and removal spells while utilizing cards that provide incremental advantage and value over time. It aims to control the game with powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and removal spells like Heartless Act, while also generating incremental value through cards like Omen of the Sea and Disinformation Campaign. The deck also includes a companion, Yorion, Sky Nomad, to enable additional synergies and value through blinking permanents.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through the use of Fires of Invention to cast powerful spells for free. It utilizes powerful control tools such as Teferi, Time Raveler and Deafening Clarion to manage the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The goal is to control the game until the late game where the player can unleash powerful threats like Cavalier of Flame and Kenrith, the Returned King to secure the win. The deck also includes powerful card draw and filtering effects to maintain consistency and find key pieces.

The deck focuses on controlling the board and disrupting the opponent's strategy by utilizing cards like Agent of Treachery, Teferi, Time Raveler, and Fires of Invention. It aims to stall the game and generate card advantage through cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Yorion, Sky Nomad. By using removal spells like Shatter the Sky and Deafening Clarion, as well as powerful planeswalkers and enchantments, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and win through incremental advantage. It also has a land base that supports its color requirements and synergizes with its strategy.

The deck focuses on controlling the board and opponent's resources using cards such as Shark Typhoon, Agent of Treachery, and Teferi, Time Raveler. It aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy by bouncing their permanents, countering their spells, and generating card advantage. The Fires of Invention enchantment allows the player to cast spells for free, enabling powerful plays like casting multiple spells in a single turn. The deck also includes cards like Yorion, Sky Nomad and Elspeth Conquers Death for additional value and flexibility.

This deck is focused on controlling the board and manipulating the opponent's resources while utilizing Fires of Invention to cast spells for free. The key strategy involves using Lukka, Coppercoat Outcast to cheat out powerful creatures like Agent of Treachery and Shark Typhoon. Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset, Parter of Veils provide disruption and card advantage, while Yorion, Sky Nomad can be used as a companion to flicker permanents for additional value. The deck also includes removal spells like Glass Casket and Deafening Clarion to maintain control of the battlefield.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by using Fires of Invention to cast spells for free and generating value through card draw and creating tokens. The deck utilizes cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset, Parter of Veils to disrupt the opponent's strategy while also using Lukka, Coppercoat Outcast to cheat out powerful creatures like Agent of Treachery. The deck also includes various removal spells like Shark Typhoon and Deafening Clarion to maintain board control and protect its win conditions.

The main concept of the deck is to control the board using spells like Agent of Treachery, Deafening Clarion, and Teferi, Time Raveler while ramping up mana with Fires of Invention. The deck also focuses on generating value through cards like Shark Typhoon and Omen of the Sun. With the help of cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Yorion, Sky Nomad, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and stay ahead in card advantage. The mana base is built to support multiple colors and ensure consistency in casting spells.

The deck focuses on utilizing Fires of Invention to cast powerful spells for free, allowing for control of the game by playing multiple threats and answers in the same turn. The deck aims to generate card advantage through cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Teferi, Time Raveler while also taking advantage of Lukka, Coppercoat Outcast to cheat out powerful creatures like Agent of Treachery. The deck also includes removal spells and counterspells to control the board and protect its game plan.

The deck aims to control the game by utilizing Fires of Invention to cast spells for free, allowing you to play multiple cards each turn. The key strategy involves using Lukka, Coppercoat Outcast to cheat out powerful creatures like Agent of Treachery or Shark Typhoon, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset, Parter of Veils. The deck also includes plenty of board wipes and card advantage engines to maintain control of the game and outvalue your opponent. Yorion, Sky Nomad serves as an additional value engine by flickering permanents for extra value.

The deck aims to control the game by utilizing Fires of Invention to cast powerful spells for free. It includes cards that provide card advantage, board wipes, and threats. The main win condition is using Lukka, Coppercoat Outcast to cheat out Agent of Treachery and steal opponent's permanents. It also includes Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion for extra value and synergy with the deck's strategy. Overall, the key concept of the deck is to establish board control, generate value, and outvalue the opponent through powerful spells and strategic plays.

The deck focuses on using Fires of Invention to cast powerful spells for free, controlling the board with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset, Parter of Veils. It also utilizes Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion for extra value and card advantage. The deck includes a variety of lands to ensure consistency and a strong mana base. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to control the game through powerful spells and strategic decision-making.

The deck focuses on quickly putting pressure on the opponent by playing aggressive creatures with various abilities, such as flying and flash. It also includes removal spells to deal with opposing threats. The goal is to control the board and deal damage efficiently, while also having some flexibility with cards like Brazen Borrower and Dirge Bat. The deck utilizes a mix of black and blue cards to create a powerful synergy and overwhelm the opponent with a fast-paced, offensive strategy.

The strategy of this deck focuses on maintaining control of the game through disruption spells and removal, while using versatile threats like Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger and Lazav, the Multifarious to pressure opponents. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for a consistent source of value from the graveyard. The deck aims to outlast opponents through attrition by leveraging its powerful control tools and efficient creatures to gradually take over the game.

The deck focuses on utilizing low-cost and efficient creatures to overwhelm the opponent quickly. By leveraging the power of strong creatures like Questing Beast, Gemrazer, and Marauding Raptor, along with the acceleration from cards like Arboreal Grazer and Migratory Greathorn, the deck aims to apply continuous pressure and finish the game swiftly. Additionally, the inclusion of powerful finishers such as End-Raze Forerunners and God-Eternal Rhonas allows for explosive plays to close out games decisively. The deck is streamlined to maximize aggression and punish opponents who are unable to keep up.

This Gruul Aggro deck focuses on using efficient and aggressive creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent. With a mix of powerful creatures like Questing Beast and Bonecrusher Giant, as well as ramp creatures like Arboreal Grazer and Gemrazer, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early and maintain that pressure throughout the game. The inclusion of Umori, the Collector as a companion adds consistency to the deck by allowing only creature spells to be cast. The deck aims to win the game quickly by maximizing damage output and utilizing its diverse creature base.

The key idea of this Jund Control deck is to use sacrifice synergies with cards like Woe Strider, Cauldron Familiar, and Mayhem Devil to control the board and chip away at your opponent's life total. Priest of Forgotten Gods helps generate value and disrupt your opponent's strategy, while cards like Claim the Firstborn and Weaponize the Monsters allow for additional creature theft and damage. The deck also utilizes Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion for additional mana fixing and ramp. Overall, the deck aims to grind out value and control the game until victory.

This deck focuses on generating value and control through sacrificing creatures and recurring them from the graveyard. It aims to create a loop utilizing cards like Witch's Oven, Cauldron Familiar, and Priest of Forgotten Gods to maintain board presence and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Mayhem Devil and Massacre Girl provide additional removal options, while Bolas's Citadel offers a powerful finisher. The deck uses a combination of card advantage, removal, and efficient creatures to outvalue the opponent and grind out a win.

The main concept of this deck is to control the board with removal spells like Domri's Ambush and creatures like Shifting Ceratops, while also putting pressure on the opponent with powerful creatures like Questing Beast and Rotting Regisaur. The deck also includes cards like Gemrazer and Shadowspear to deal with problematic artifacts and enchantments, as well as Embercleave for additional damage output. The goal is to maintain board control while putting pressure on the opponent to secure a victory.

The main concept of this Jund Control deck is to establish board control through sacrificing and recurring small creatures like Cauldron Familiar and Woe Strider to generate value and disrupt the opponent's game plan. By utilizing cards like Trail of Crumbs and Priest of Forgotten Gods, the deck aims to generate card advantage and mana advantage to eventually overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats like Korvold, Fae-Cursed King and Bolas's Citadel. The deck also includes removal spells like Claim the Firstborn and Mayhem Devil to handle threats from the opponent's side of the board.

This deck focuses on utilizing sacrifice mechanics to control the board and deal incremental damage to the opponent while generating value. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of aggressive creatures and combo pieces like Cauldron Familiar and Witch's Oven. By combining sacrifice effects with powerful triggers like Priest of Forgotten Gods and Cruel Celebrant, the deck can quickly close out games and outvalue the opponent. Lurrus of the Dream-Den provides additional recursion and synergy with the deck's strategy.

The key concept of this Mardu Aggro deck is to utilize sacrifice effects and recursion to generate value and drain the opponent's life total. By combining cards like Witch's Oven, Cauldron Familiar, and Priest of Forgotten Gods, the deck aims to create a steady stream of damage and card advantage. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Claim the Firstborn and Soul-Guide Lantern to disrupt opponents' game plans. Overall, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and drain the opponent's life total quickly through a combination of sacrificing creatures and dealing direct damage.

The focus of this deck is to overwhelm your opponent with a fast and aggressive playstyle, utilizing a combination of strong creatures and removal spells to maintain board control. By consistently playing low-cost creatures and using combat tricks like Fight as One, the deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain that pressure throughout the match. The inclusion of Lurrus as a companion allows for additional recursion of key creatures, ensuring that the deck can continue to push for victory even in the late game.

This Mardu Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creatures such as Knight of the Ebon Legion, Inspiring Veteran, and Fervent Champion to quickly deal damage to the opponent. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for continuous recursion of low-cost creatures and spells. With strong synergies between creatures like Worthy Knight, Corpse Knight, and Smitten Swordmaster, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a relentless assault, while also incorporating versatile removal spells like Dire Tactics and Redcap Melee to keep control of the board.

The main concept of this Mono Black Aggro deck is to establish board presence early with aggressive creatures such as Knight of the Ebon Legion and Serrated Scorpion, while utilizing synergies like Witch's Oven and Cauldron Familiar for incremental value and life drain. The deck focuses on efficient removal with cards like Dead Weight and Drill Bit, as well as card advantage and recursion with cards like Priest of Forgotten Gods and Fiend Artisan. Additionally, the inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for additional value and recursion throughout the game.

This Mono Green Aggro deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures like Gingerbrute, Questing Beast, and Pelt Collector early on to quickly overwhelm the opponent. Syr Faren, the Hengehammer and Lovestruck Beast provide additional power, while Gemrazer can be used to deal with enemy artifacts and enchantments. Giant Growth and Titanic Growth are included for combat tricks and additional damage. The deck aims to establish board presence early and maintain pressure throughout the game with its efficient and powerful creatures.

This deck focuses on quickly building a strong board presence with efficient and aggressive creatures like Questing Beast, Yorvo, and Pelt Collector. Using mana acceleration from cards like Castle Garenbrig, the deck aims to play powerful threats early and overwhelm the opponent. The Great Henge provides card draw and additional ramp, while Vivien, Champion of the Wilds and Vivien, Arkbow Ranger offer utility and removal options. The deck's mono green nature allows for consistency in mana base and enables powerful synergies between cards.

The deck focuses on utilizing fast and aggressive creatures along with pump spells to overwhelm the opponent quickly. By using cards like Swiftblade Vindicator, Fervent Champion, and Gruul Spellbreaker with pump spells like Giant Growth and Infuriate, the deck aims to deal a large amount of damage in a short amount of time. Additionally, the inclusion of Dreadhorde Arcanist allows for the potential to recast pump spells from the graveyard. The deck is further supported by Season of Growth for card draw and Domri's Ambush for removal.

The deck focuses on using cheap and efficient creatures like Cauldron Familiar, Orzhov Enforcer, and Midnight Reaper to deal damage quickly to the opponent. By sacrificing creatures with cards like Witch's Oven and Woe Strider, the deck can trigger abilities like Cruel Celebrant and Bastion of Remembrance to drain the opponent's life total. Luminous Broodmoth provides resilience by returning creatures to play if they die, and Bolas's Citadel provides a powerful late-game option to close out the game. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with constant pressure and drain effects.

This Rakdos Aggro deck aims to overwhelm the opponent through aggressive creature plays and recurring damage. By utilizing cards like Kroxa, Knight of the Ebon Legion, and Dreadhorde Butcher, along with sacrificing creatures with the help of Priest of Forgotten Gods and Witch's Oven, this deck can apply constant pressure on the opponent. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for additional creature recursion, making it difficult for the opponent to keep up with the deck's fast-paced, aggressive strategy.

The deck focuses on utilizing small, aggressive creatures and sacrificing them to generate value. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of quick creature plays, sacrifice effects, and recurring threats. The key strategy involves sacrificing creatures like Cauldron Familiar and Serrated Scorpion to trigger abilities that benefit the player, while utilizing cards like Priest of Forgotten Gods and Witch's Oven to generate additional advantages. By combining aggressive creature plays with sacrifice synergies, the deck seeks to maintain board presence and apply relentless pressure on the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize low-cost creatures and sacrifice synergies to apply pressure early in the game, while also gaining incremental value through recurring creatures like Cauldron Familiar and Gutterbones. By sacrificing creatures with cards like Witch's Oven and Claim the Firstborn, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and generate additional resources. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for further recursion and resilience in the late game, making it a versatile and aggressive deck in the current standard 1 vs 1 format.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on utilizing low-to-the-ground creatures like Gutterbones, Woe Strider, and Dreadhorde Butcher to apply pressure early on. The deck also includes powerful sacrifice synergies with Priest of Forgotten Gods and Mayhem Devil, as well as the Cauldron Familiar and Witch's Oven combo for additional value. Claim the Firstborn and Heartless Act provide removal and disruption, while Robber of the Rich offers card advantage. The deck's main goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy while utilizing sacrifice effects for incremental advantages.

The main idea of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy focused on dealing damage quickly. The deck includes powerful creatures such as Bonecrusher Giant, Phoenix of Ash, and Anax, Hardened in the Forge, supported by cards like Heraldic Banner and Castle Embereth to boost their effectiveness. With a low curve and direct damage spells like Shock and Light Up the Stage, the deck aims to close out games swiftly before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

The deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with quick, aggressive plays using low-cost red creatures and burn spells. The goal is to deal damage as quickly as possible and finish off the opponent before they can stabilize. The addition of Obosh, the Preypiercer as a companion increases the damage output of odd-costed cards in the deck. Cards like Heraldic Banner and Fervent Champion help boost the overall damage potential, while resilient creatures like Anax, Hardened in the Forge and Phoenix of Ash provide staying power in the late game.

This deck focuses on quickly dealing damage to the opponent by playing aggressive creatures and utilizing burn spells. The key strategy is to apply pressure early in the game with cheap and efficient creatures like Fervent Champion and Robber of the Rich, supported by cards like Torbran, Thane of Red Fell and Embercleave to increase damage output. Leyline of Combustion and Grafdigger's Cage provide disruption against opposing strategies, while cards like Light Up the Stage and Castle Embereth help maintain card advantage and provide additional reach. This deck aims to win the game before the opponent can stabilize.

This deck focuses on quickly building up a board presence with low-cost creatures like Gingerbrute and Stonecoil Serpent, while boosting their power with enchantments like All That Glitters and Glaring Aegis. Season of Growth helps to draw more cards and keep the aggression going. Alseid of Life's Bounty provides protection for key creatures, while Lurrus of the Dream-Den serves as a powerful companion to recover any lost creatures. The deck combines aggressive creatures with protective spells to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory.

The deck focuses on using cheap and efficient creatures and enchantments to quickly build up a strong board presence. By utilizing cards like All That Glitters and Sentinel's Eyes, the deck aims to pump up its creatures and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive attacks. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for continuous card advantage and recursion of important creatures. The deck also includes protection spells like Gods Willing and Karametra's Blessing to keep its creatures safe and maintain pressure on the opponent.

The key concept of this deck is to utilize the Aggro strategy with a Simic color combination. The deck focuses on aggressive and fast-paced gameplay, aiming to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The deck includes supportive cards like Stonecoil Serpent, End-Raze Forerunners, Arboreal Grazer, Gemrazer, Migratory Greathorn, Pollywog Symbiote, Pouncing Shoreshark, Auspicious Starrix, Paradise Druid, Blast Zone, Ketria Triome, Temple of Mystery, Castle Garenbrig, Breeding Pool, Island, and Forest. The deck is streamlined for efficiency, allowing for explosive early game plays and maintaining control throughout the game.

This deck focuses on quickly developing a board presence by playing low-cost and efficient creatures such as Pouncing Shoreshark and Gemrazer. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and supportive cards like Auspicious Starrix and End-Raze Forerunners. The inclusion of Umori, the Collector as a companion allows for a more streamlined and consistent deck construction. By utilizing cards that allow for early game ramp like Arboreal Grazer and Paradise Druid, the deck aims to quickly build up resources and push for a fast win.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the companion Umori, the Collector to reduce the cost of all creature spells in the deck. The deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures such as Auspicious Starrix, End-Raze Forerunners, and Questing Beast to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It also includes cards like Arboreal Grazer and Paradise Druid to ramp up mana quickly and enable playing bigger threats earlier in the game. Additionally, cards like Stonecoil Serpent and Gemrazer provide flexibility and protection against different types of threats.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and powerful threats. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Thought Erasure and Casualties of War, while also generating card advantage and gaining life with Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Hydroid Krasis. The deck utilizes a variety of lands to ensure it has access to all three colors of mana needed for its spells. Overall, the deck seeks to outvalue and outlast the opponent in a long, grindy game.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by providing answers to threats while ramping up mana to cast big spells like Expansion / Explosion and Shark Typhoon. Utilizing cards like Wilderness Reclamation and Growth Spiral to accelerate into powerful plays, the deck aims to out-value and out-last the opponent. Brazen Borrower and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath provide additional tools for disruption and card advantage, making it difficult for the opponent to establish a strong board presence. Overall, the goal is to establish control of the game and ultimately overwhelm the opponent with powerful spells.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by using a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw. The deck aims to ramp up mana quickly with cards like Growth Spiral and Wilderness Reclamation to be able to cast powerful spells such as Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Shark Typhoon. The deck also includes a variety of lands to ensure it has the right colors of mana available. Overall, the deck aims to control the board and outvalue the opponent with powerful, versatile spells.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by countering opponent's spells, drawing cards, and generating value with cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Shark Typhoon. The deck aims to ramp up its mana with cards like Growth Spiral and Wilderness Reclamation to cast powerful spells like Expansion / Explosion. It also includes board wipes like Flame Sweep and Storm's Wrath to deal with aggressive strategies. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue opponents and control the game until it can win with its powerful threats.

This deck focuses on utilizing Winota, Joiner of Forces to quickly flood the board with creatures and overwhelm the opponent. By playing creatures with strong enter the battlefield abilities, such as Brazen Borrower and Agent of Treachery, the deck aims to create an aggressive board presence and generate value through Winota's triggered ability. The deck also includes cards like Legion Warboss and Raise the Alarm to consistently produce tokens and further increase the pressure on the opponent. Winota is the key card that drives the deck's strategy of aggressive creature-based combat.

The deck focuses on building a board presence quickly with a mix of creatures that can provide value or disrupt the opponent's board state. The main goal is to capitalize on Winota's ability to cheat powerful creatures onto the battlefield by attacking with a mix of non-human creatures. The inclusion of cards like Gilded Goose and Charming Prince helps to ramp up and protect key creatures like Winota, while cards like Stonecoil Serpent and Marauding Raptor provide additional aggression and utility. The mana base is designed to support the various colors needed for the deck's powerful creatures and spells.

The deck focuses on rapidly deploying creatures with varying converted mana costs to trigger Winota, Joiner of Forces' ability, allowing you to cheat powerful creatures onto the battlefield for free. By using cards like Stonecoil Serpent, Marauding Raptor, and Agent of Treachery, you can overwhelm your opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive effects. The inclusion of Umori as a companion ensures consistency in your deck by limiting the types of cards you can include, maximizing the efficiency of your strategy.

The key concept of the deck is to quickly ramp up mana with cards like Paradise Druid and Gilded Goose to play high-impact creatures such as Winota, Joiner of Forces and Agent of Treachery. By utilizing these powerful creatures, along with aggressive creatures like Legion Warboss, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive playstyle. Additionally, cards like Sphinx of Foresight help ensure a strong opening hand. The overall strategy is to establish board presence early and maintain pressure to secure a victory.

The deck focuses on quickly getting Winota, Joiner of Forces onto the battlefield and triggering her ability to cheat powerful human creatures into play. The deck contains a mix of aggressive creatures, mana ramp, and land cards that support the strategy of overwhelming the opponent with a high number of threats. The use of Umori, the Collector as a companion adds consistency and efficiency to the deck by allowing only creature spells to be included in the main deck.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana with cards like Paradise Druid and Gilded Goose, while placing strong creatures like Legion Warboss and Winota on the battlefield to pressure the opponent. By using cards like Neoform and Adventurous Impulse to search for key pieces, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a steady stream of creatures, with Winota's ability to cheat them into play providing a significant advantage. The deck thrives on fast, aggressive plays to put pressure on the opponent and secure a quick victory.

The main concept of the deck is to quickly assemble a board full of creatures, using Winota's ability to cheat powerful creatures like Agent of Treachery onto the battlefield. By including creatures with enter-the-battlefield effects like Alirios, Enraptured and Hanged Executioner, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with value and aggression. Supporting cards like Neoform and Fight as One can help protect and enhance the creatures on the battlefield, while the mana base provides the necessary colors to consistently cast the deck's spells.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping up with mana-producing creatures like Gilded Goose and Arboreal Grazer, while also creating tokens with cards like Legion Warboss and Hanged Executioner. The goal is to get Winota, Joiner of Forces onto the battlefield and use her ability to cheat powerful creatures like Agent of Treachery into play for free. Utilizing cards like Neoform and Fblthp, the Lost to tutor for key pieces, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and steal their best threats to secure victory.

The deck focuses on aggressive gameplay by quickly summoning a variety of low-cost creatures onto the battlefield. This is achieved through the use of Winota, Joiner of Forces to cheat out powerful creatures like Haktos the Unscarred and Tajic, Legion's Edge. The deck also includes synergy with sacrificing creatures for value, utilizing cards like Cauldron Familiar and Witch's Oven for extra damage and lifegain. Other cards like Judith, the Scourge Diva and Syr Konrad, the Grim provide additional ways to increase damage and pressure opponents.

The deck focuses on utilizing Winota, Joiner of Forces to quickly ramp up an aggressive board presence, overwhelming the opponent with powerful creatures. The deck includes a mix of token generators, value creatures, and removal spells to control the battlefield and enable Winota triggers. The main goal is to swarm the battlefield with creatures and leverage Winota's ability to cheat out high-impact creatures like Agent of Treachery and Legion Warboss, leading to powerful combat swings and potentially winning the game in just a few turns.

This deck focuses on building a strong board presence quickly with low-cost creatures and enchantments that buff them up. The key strategy is to protect and enhance your small creatures using spells like Karametra's Blessing and Gods Willing, while also equipping them with cards like All That Glitters and Sentinel's Eyes to make them more threatening. The goal is to overwhelm your opponent with a swarm of efficient creatures and take advantage of Lurrus of the Dream-Den's ability to recur your fallen creatures for continued pressure.

This deck aims to flood the board with low-cost, evasive white creatures and enchantments to enhance their power and protect them from removal. Lurrus of the Dream-Den serves as a companion to provide consistent card advantage by allowing you to cast low-cost permanents from your graveyard. The deck focuses on quickly building a wide board presence with aggressive creatures like Gingerbrute and Healer's Hawk, while using protective spells like Gods Willing and Karametra's Blessing to ensure those creatures can deal damage efficiently.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by constantly disrupting the opponent's strategy while generating incremental advantages. It utilizes a mix of removal spells, card advantage engines, and powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler to control the board and outvalue the opponent. With a high density of cards that provide card selection and filtering, the deck aims to consistently find answers to threats and maintain a firm grip over the game. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion provides additional value and flexibility, allowing for more options in longer games.

The main strategy of this deck is to control the game by countering spells, removing threats, and generating card advantage. Utilizing cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset, Parter of Veils to disrupt opponents' strategies, along with counterspells like Dovin's Veto and Mystical Dispute to prevent key spells from resolving. The deck also includes board wipes like Shatter the Sky to deal with wide boards. With Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion, the deck aims to outvalue opponents with additional flicker effects and card draw from ETB triggers.
